boat.name: Mayblossom
boat.full_description:
Mayblossom was built and owned by Mr B Patten in Althorne Essex in 1973. Mr GA Marshall owned her for 3 ½ years before bringing her down to the Dart in Devon from Jul 1983 (?). Since then she has been used to cruise the coasts and rivers of Devon and Cornwall. She has taken part in the Brixham Heritage Regatta, OGA South West events and Plymouth & Fowey Classics.

She is a pretty, well-designed boat. Her lifting keel means that she has also explored the upper reaches of the Exe, Dart, Tamar, Fowey and Helford

She was brought down to Helford from Brixham in 2018 and proved to be a very kindly boat - easily sailed single handed. She entered the Falmouth classics in June 2018 and 2019. In May 2019 her keel fell off (3/4" bolt rusted through) and keel had to be manufactured from drawings. This was completed in time to the Falmouth classics and she is back in the water. She also attended the SW Gaffers parade of sail at Plymouth in Jul 2019 overnighting at Cawsand and Polperro.
boat.construction_details: Clinker, iroko on oak with copper rivets and a galvanised iron keel, cast iron ballast on keel and internal.
boat.short_description: Mayblossom is a New Blossom Class Yacht designed by John Leather and built in 1973.

builderByBuilder.name: Patten P or Gale H. and Sons

for_sales.sales_text:
LOD19’4", LOA 23’ including bowsprit, LWL 18’6". Clinker built in 1973 by Patten Bros., Althorne, Essex in iroko on oak ribs with a mahogany superstructure. This is the ultimate pocket cruiser that sleeps two on full length berths with plenty of storage.

Fitted galley with gas hob and grill, sink, worktop and storage. Chart table with sea toilet under. In recent years used to cruise Devon and Cornwall. Fitted with a Tohatsu 9.8hp out board motor and currently lying in Brixham

Her design featured in John Leather’s book "Wooden Boat Building" with copies of the original working drawings available. A full history of the class and Mayblossom in particular, are available from the current owner and also held in the Mersea Museum.

Last dry survey 2013.
